description_txt: stated on June 27, 2011 in a news release:
quote_txt: Says U.S. Sen. Sherrod Brown is responsible for "over $14 trillion in debt."

description_txt: stated on June 29, 2011 in a press release:
quote_txt: Says legislative debate of airport pat-down procedures initiated federal changes in security procedures.

description_txt: stated on July 5, 2011 in a press release:
quote_txt: "In our proposal, we would have expanded school aid across the board … Governor Christie slashed school aid in this budget, preferring instead to extend a tax break for millionaires over funding in the classroom."

description_txt: stated on June 21, 2011 in a television interview:
quote_txt: Says many public-employee unions falsely told their Wisconsin members his budget-repair bill sought 12 percent to 13 percent of their incomes for health insurance premiums.

description_txt: stated on June 27, 2011 in a statement by state Democratic chairman Ray Buckley in a call with reporters:
quote_txt: "Mitt Romney is the first Massachusetts politician to run for president and not win the New Hampshire primary in a generation."

description_txt: stated on June 27, 2011 in a roundtable with small business leaders in Salem, N.H.:
quote_txt: By the end of his first term, President Obama will have added as much debt as all the prior 43 presidents combined.

description_txt: stated on June 23, 2011 in an interview on New Jersey 101.5 FM:
quote_txt: Says the average government worker won't be impacted in the first two years under the reform of state health benefits.

description_txt: stated on June 29, 2011 in report:
quote_txt: "Dubious taxpayer-funded stimulus projects in Rhode Island include … $250,000 to provide digital television to the state’s inmate population."

description_txt: stated on June 22, 2011 in remarks to the Central Texas Democratic Forum:
quote_txt: "We’re losing almost 6,000 state jobs."

description_txt: stated on July 7, 2011 in a Senate floor speech:
quote_txt: "Fifty-one percent -- that is, a majority of American households -- paid no income tax in 2009. Zero. Zip. Nada."

description_txt: stated on July 2, 2011 in a TV interview.:
quote_txt: "China owns more of our bonds than do Americans."

description_txt: stated on June 26, 2011 in an interview on 10 News Conference:
quote_txt: Rhode Island spends "52 percent more per capita on human service programs than the national average."
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • July 8, 2011

description_txt: stated on June 27, 2011 in a television interview:
quote_txt: Newt Gingrich’s presidential campaign has "exactly the same" challenges as Ronald Reagan’s successful 1980 bid.

description_txt: stated on June 20, 2011 in a rally at the Statehouse:
quote_txt: "This governor has cut funding repeatedly for people who have AIDS, who need drugs to save their life."

description_txt: stated on July 5, 2011 in an interview with the "St. Petersburg Times" editorial board:
quote_txt: "Let’s say (Republicans) take away half of our delegates. They’re worth more than Iowa’s, New Hampshire’s and almost South Carolina’s combined."

description_txt: stated on July 6, 2011 in a Twitter Town Hall:
quote_txt: Says that when President Bill Clinton raised the top tax rates to levels now proposed by Obama, the country experienced significant job growth.

description_txt: stated on July 6, 2011 in a Twitter town hall:
quote_txt: "Young veterans have a higher unemployment rate than people who didn’t serve."

description_txt: stated on July 6, 2011 in a Twitter town hall:
quote_txt: "We have provided at least 16 tax cuts to small businesses."

description_txt: stated on July 3, 2011 in an interview on "Fox News Sunday":
quote_txt: Forty percent of union members voted Republican in 2008.

description_txt: stated on June 30, 2011 in a news release:
quote_txt: On repeal of Wisconsin's smoking ban

description_txt: stated on June 1, 2011 in testimony before a House subcommittee:
quote_txt: "Ohio currently ranks 50th out of all states in income growth."

description_txt: stated on June 16, 2011 in an "On the Line" interview with Steve Adubato:
quote_txt: Says car insurance rates have decreased since about a decade ago because of market-based solutions that attracted more auto insurers to New Jersey.

description_txt: stated on July 3, 2011 in an interview on CNN's "State of the Union with Candy Crowley":
quote_txt: Housing prices dropped for the 30 months prior to Barack Obama taking office, "and they have stabilized, they've been about flat since the president came in."

description_txt: stated on July 3, 2011 in an interview on CNN:
quote_txt: "Forty percent of the Fortune 500 were started either by immigrants or children of immigrants."

description_txt: stated on June 24, 2011 in a news release:
quote_txt: Says Gov. Scott Walker’s budget "includes tax breaks for corporations and the rich that will cost the state of Wisconsin taxpayers $2.3 billion over the next decade."

description_txt: stated on June 25, 2011 in an op-ed.:
quote_txt: "Under Gov. Rick Perry’s leadership [Texas] has created more jobs over the last decade than the rest of the states combined."

description_txt: stated on June 18, 2011 in a campaign mailer.:
quote_txt: Says that under City Council Member Randi Shade, Austin had the "highest city debt per person in Texas."

description_txt: stated on June 7, 2011 in a chart:
quote_txt: From 1947 to 1979, family incomes for rich, middle-income and poor Americans grew about the same rate. But since 1979, incomes for rich families have grown much faster.

description_txt: stated on June 16, 2011 in an interview on the Fox Business Channel:
quote_txt: A year since the "Recovery Summer," there has been been "a fall, winter and spring of no recovery."

description_txt: stated on May 18, 2011 in press releases:
quote_txt: U.S. Reps. John Barrow and Sanford Bishop and their fellow Democrats "went on a spending spree and now their credit card is maxed out."
